Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First I need to understand the normative rules and the desiderata The normative rules are strict so any violation here is a serious issue The desiderata are just recommendations so theyre not as critical but still important to note

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Starting with the event logs for each case

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1 Looking at the activities the sequence seems correct Starts with Application Received then Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Approved Inform Applicant Finalize Documentation Close Case The order follows the required sequence For the approved case they finalized docs before closing No steps skipped or reversed So probably no normative violation here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: But check the desiderata The Credit Check was done 30 minutes after application which is within 24 hours Informing applicant was done 2 hours after decision which is under 48 hours Also theres no Followup Call but thats just a desideratum So Case 1 might not have desiderata issues except maybe the Followup Call missing

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 First activity is Application Received Next is Risk Assessment but theres no prior Credit Check Thats a clear violation of the normative rule because Credit Check must come before Risk Assessment Then Credit Check is done after Risk Assessment which is reversing the order Then Loan Decision Rejected but after that they Finalize Documentation which isnt allowed for rejections Then Close Case So two normative violations here order of Risk Assessment before Credit Check and Finalize Doc after rejection So definitely Case 2 violates norms

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Application Received then Credit Check happened on the 14th which is 4 days later from 12th 0900 to 14th 1000 Wait the dates are 20240112 0900 to 20240114 1000 Thats two days later which is 48 hours plus The desideratum says Credit Check should be within 24 hours so this is a violation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Then Risk Assessment Loan Decision Approved Inform Applicant was done on 16th 1500 The Loan Decision was on 14th 1200 So the time between decision and inform is 2 days and 3 hours which is way over 48 hours Another desideratum violation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Finalize Doc and Close Case followed Also no Followup Call which is another desideratum But normative sequence Application Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Finalize Close All steps in order Approved loan followed the correct path So no normative violations here only desiderata issues

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So summarizing 1 Normative Violations Case 2 Risk Assessment before Credit Check Finalize Documentation after rejection 2 Desiderata Violations Case 1 Missing Followup Call Case 3 Credit Check took more than 24h Inform Applicant took more than 48h missing Followup Call

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Possible justifications For Case 2 maybe the system had an error causing activities to be logged out of order or the user made a mistake in entering data For Case 3 perhaps delays were due to weekends or high workload but they followed the required steps The missing Followup Calls might be skipped due to oversight or resource constraints which is acceptable since its not mandatory
